radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral inferior lateral masses involving the orbital floors producing marked superior displacement of the orbital contents; intrinsic expansile bone lesions involved the inferior and lateral orbital walls with apical compression of the optic nerves.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Eighteen months postoperatively, optic nerve dysfunction, proptosis, and diplopia in upgaze remained. Seven years after initial surgery, there was a recurrence in the left orbital floor with direct compression on the optic nerve, causing a sudden decrease in vision.
